results.title: Edouard et Caroline = Edward and Caroline
results.creator_credit: Jacques Becker, Raymond Borderie and Robert Bossis
results.brief_description:
A young married couple quarrel on the eve of a party that can make or break the spouse’s career as a pianist.

Credits: Producer, Robert Bossis, Raymond Borderie ; director, Jacques Becker ; writers, Annette Wademant, Jacques Becker ; photography, Robert Le Febvre ; music, Jean-Jacques Grunenwald ; editor, Marguerite Renoir ; assistant director, Marcel Camus ;
Cast: Anne Vernon, Daniel Gelin, Jacques Francois, Elina Labourdette, Betty Stockfeld, Jean Riveyre.

results.title: Hardi! Pardaillan
results.brief_description:
Pardaillan has been entrusted by King Henri III with a letter he must pass on to Henri de Bearn. King Henri is besieged in the city of Chartres and is asking for help. After surviving many ambushes, Pardaillan must also contend with a fanatical monk who is plotting against the king. This is the second installment of the adventures of Pardaillan. See also: ‘Le Chavalier de Pardaillan’ (X000503) in our collection.

Credits: Producer, Henri Jaquillard ; director, Bernard Borderie ; writers, Henri-Andre Legrand, Andre Haguet, Bernard Borderie ; photography, Henri Persin ; music, Paul Misraki ; costumes, Rosine Delamare.
Cast: Gerard Barray, Valerie Lagrange, Philippe Lemaire, Guy Delorme, Jean Topart.

results.title: Trois Milliards Sans Ascenseur
results.creator_credit: Roger Pigaut, Andre Cohen, Eugene Lepicier and Marcel Sebaoun
results.brief_description:
Five friends living in a blue-collar neighborhood which is being demolished to make way for a new office and housing development band together to save their neighborhood and get rich along the way. They set up on a complicated plot involving both jewel theft and insurance fraud. Things get even more complicated when they call for the services of an expert burglar.

Credits: Producers, Andre Cohen, Marcel Sebaoun, Eugene Lepicier ; director, Roger Pigaut ; writers, Roger Pigaut, Andre G. Brunelin ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Teo Usuelli.
Cast: Serge Reggiani, Michel Bouquet, Francoise Rosay, Bernard Fresson, Dany Carrel, Amidou, Gabriele Ferzetti, Marcel Bozzuffi, Victor Lanoux, Nike Arrighi.

results.title: La Chartreuse de Parme = the Charterhouse of Parma
results.brief_description:
Fabrice returns to Parma to live with his aunt, Duchess Sanseverina. He is unaware of her feelings for him and looks for amourous adventures all over town. A jealous man challenges him to a duel and Fabrice kills him. After his arrest and trial, Fabrice is condemned to 12 years imprisonment and taken to the Farnese tower. There, he seduces Clelia, the daughter of the prison governor.

Credits: Producer, Andre Paulve ; director, Christian-Jaque ; writers, Christian-Jaque, Pierre Very, Pierre Jary ; photography, Nicolas Hayer, Romolo Garrone ; music, Renzo Rosselini.
Cast: Gerard Philipe, Renee Faure, Maria Casares, Lucien Coedel, Albert Remy, Louis Salou.

results.title: Le Rendez-Vous de Minuit = Rendez-Vous at Midnight
results.brief_description:
At the cinema Jacques is watching a film called ‘Rendez-vous de Minuit’ starring Lilli Palmer and Maurice Ronet. Eva, a young woman next to him, becomes emotional and rushes out of the cinema. Concerned, Jacques goes after her and she explains that her life is following the pattern of the film’s heroine and that she is to commit suicide as the character does on screen.

Credits: Producer, Jean Thuillier ; director, Roger Leenhardt ; writers, Jean-Pierre Vivet, Roger Leenhardt ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Georges Auric ; art direction, Bernard Evein ; costumes, Pierre Balmain.
Cast: Lilli Palmer, Michel Auclair, Jean Galland, Maurice Ronet, Michel De Re, France Anglade, Michele Meritz, Lucienne Le Marchand, Bruno Balp, Jose Luis de Vilallonga, Robert Lombard, Daniel Emilfork.

results.title: L'apprenti Salaud = the Apprentice Heel
results.brief_description:
Antoine was a pleasant and agreeable man for years, until a small inheritance begins to give him some dangerous ideas about gaining wealth and women. Partly in order to win the affections of a young woman, he becomes a small-time con man on the basis of some ideas his accountant has planted in his mind.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Michel Deville ; writer, Michel Deville ; photography, Claude Lecomte ; music, Georges Bizet.
Cast: Robert Lamoureux, Christine Dejoux, Claude Pieplu, Georges Wilson, Jean-Pierre Kalfon, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze, Jean-Francois Derec, Bernard Lavalette, Annick Blancheteau.

results.title: Le Rat D'amerique = the Rat Trap
results.brief_description:
Charles migrates to Paraguay. He meets Maria, a young cashier in money changing outlet and falls in love with her. Short of money and short on prospects, Charles becomes involved in a gun smuggling

Credits: Director, Jean-Gabriel Albicocco ; writers, Jacques Lanzmann, Jean-Gabriel Albicocco ; photography, Quinto Albicocco ; music, Georges Garvarentz.
Cast: Charles Aznavour, Marie Laforet, Franco Fabrizzi.

results.title: Jeannot L'intrepide = Fearless Johnny
results.brief_description:
During a walk, Jeannot and his brothers become lost in the forest. While trying to find their way back, they enter the house of the ogre.

Credits: Director, Jean Image ; writers, Jean Image, Eraine, Paul Colline ; photography, Kostia Tchikine ; music, Rene Cloerec ; animation, Andre Champeaux.

results.title: L'intrepide = the Intrepid
results.brief_description:
Didier, a surgeon in a Paris hospital, saves the life of Canello, a famous gangster. In order to show Didier how grateful he really is, Canello offers to eliminate Lydie, Didier’s overbearing fiancee. The contract on Lydie must be executed during an overnight train trip. But at the last minute, Lydie gives her seat to an other woman. Didier must now save the woman from becoming a victim of Canello.

Credits: Producer, Alain Darbon ; director, Jean Girault ; writer, Jacques Wilfried, Andre Versini, Rene Versini ; photography, Guy Suzuki ; music, Raymond Lefevre.
Cast: Louis Velle, Claudine Auger, Juliette Mills, Roger Hanin, Michel Galabru.

results.title: L'heritier = the Heir
results.brief_description:
Bart Cordell inherits his father’s business following his father’s accidental death. Bart is convinced the circumstances of this death were dubious and may be part of a ploy to destabilise his financial empire. He hires a private detective and finds that a reporter working for his father’s magazine (one of the many companies he owned) was looking into plans by another multinational to take over the company. Cordell also discovers that his father-in-law, a former Italian fascist, may not have given up his old loyalties.

Credits: Producer, Jacques-Eric Strauss ; director, Philippe Labro ; writers, Jacques Lanzmann, Philippe Labro ; photography, Jean Penzer ; music, Michel Colombier ; art direction, Theobald Meurisse.
Cast: Jean-Paul Belmondo, Carla Gravina, Jean Rochefort, Charles Denner, Maureen Kerwin.
